short_summary: Inspection and maintenance of garage doors - Quebec Base (Quebec)
description:
Trade Agreement: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)", "Tendering Procedures: All interested suppliers may submit a bid", "Competitive Procurement Strategy: Lowest/Lower Bid", "Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement: No", "Nature of Requirements: Inspection and maintenance of garage doors Quebec Base (Quebec)", "DESCRIPTION: Public Works and Government Services Canada requires inspection, maintenance and repair services to ensure the proper operation of the garage doors at the Quebec base at 101 Champlain Boulevard. The work required is to make five (5) annual inspection visits and ten (10) semi-annual inspection visits, during normal working hours and days and also maintenance on request. The first inspection visit will be made in September and the second in March of each year. The garage doors are located at the Quebec base at the following locations: - Building 100 - Building 400 - Building 500 - Building 600 - Building 900 
 SITE VISIT / BIDDERS’ CONFERENCE: There will be no site visit. However, bidders can contact the contracting authority to request an appointment for a site visit if they find it necessary. No questions will be answered during the site visit. All questions will be submitted in writing to the contracting authority 
 SECURITY REQUIREMENTS: There is security requirements applicable to this Agreement. 
 INQUIRIES: All inquiries and comments regarding this Request for Proposal are to be submitted ONLY to the Contracting Authority, Serge Jean, by e-mail to serge.jean@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca or by phone to 418-928-1906. 
 LANGUAGES: This PWGSC office provides acquisition services to the public in both official languages. 
 Date de livraison : Above-mentioned 
 The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. 
 Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. 
 SIGNING AUTHORITY: The signing authority for the Contract is responsible for ensuring that all terms and conditions of the Contract are strictly adhered to and met. 
 All questions and queries related to the Contracting Authority, it is requested to submit ONLY to the copied numbered. 8 
 C:\
tags: Inspection and maintenance of garage doors
full_summary:
**Government Tender Announcement - Inspection and Maintenance of Garage Doors - Quebec Base (Québec)**

* **Reference Number**: PW-QCM-039-18359
* **Solicitation Number**: EE517-222081/B
* **Publication Date**: September 22, 2022
* **Tender Closing Date**: October 12, 2022 2:00 PM
* **Tender Status**: Expired
* **Notice Type**: Request for Proposal
* **Procurement Method**: Competitive - Open Bidding
* **Trade Agreements**: CFTA - Canadian Free Trade Agreement
* **Regions of Opportunity**: Quebec (excl. NCR)
* **Regions of Delivery**: Quebec (excl. NCR)
* **Contracting Entity**: Public Works and Government Services Canada
* **Contact Person**: Serge Jean (serge.jean@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca; 418-928-1906)

**Description**
Public Works and Government Services Canada requires inspection, maintenance, and repair services for the garage doors at the Quebec Base (101 Champlain Blvd). The scope of work includes:

* Five (5) annual inspections and ten (10) semi-annual inspections, during normal working hours and days
* Maintenance on request
* Inspection visits to be conducted in September and March of each year
* Five (5) locations: Building 100, Building 400, Building 500, Building 600, and Building 900

**Notice**
Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, temporary measures are in place to encourage social distancing at the bid receiving unit. Submissions MUST be sent via EPOST Connect service offered by Canada Post.

**Inquiries**
All inquiries and comments regarding this Request for Proposal should be submitted in writing to Serge Jean (serge.jean@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca).

**Languages**
This PWGSC office provides acquisition services to the public in both official languages.

**Delivery Date**
The above-mentioned date.

**Addendum**
The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. Security requirements are applicable to this agreement. Suppliers are required to submit their bid in accordance with the attached document. (Attachments: ACWORDS Prototype.pdf in English and ACWORDS Prototype.pdf in French) .
